New Records: Karl-Anthony Towns became the last Knicks player since Patrick Ewing to collect over 30 points and 20 rebounds in multiple games in a single season.
Key Match Events: The Knicks outscored Utah 32-21 in the second quarter to take control.
Colin Sexton finished with 25 points on 10 of 13 shooting and 4 of 5 from beyond the arc.
Jordan Clarkson scored 25 points off the bench.
Pre-Game Insights: No Jalen Brunson and Deuce McBride played due to injuries.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks are now just 0.5 games behind the Atlantic Division-leading Boston Celtics.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cameron Payne played 36 minutes at point guard despite a tough shooting night.
Landry Shamet and rookie Tyler Kolek also played in the game.
Others: The Knicks will next turn their attention to a Friday night road game against the Oklahoma City Thunder.
